Name: autosomal dominant chronic granulomatous disease
Definition: A chronic granulomatous disease characterized by autosomal dominant inheritance.

Name: autosomal recessive chronic granulomatous disease cytochrome b-positive type II
Definition: A chronic granulomatous disease characterized by autosomal recessive inheritance that has_material_basis_in mutation in the NCF2 gene on chromosome 1q25.

Name: autosomal recessive chronic granulomatous disease cytochrome b-positive type I
Definition: A chronic granulomatous disease characterized by autosomal recessive inheritance that has_material_basis_in mutation in the NCF1 gene on chromosome 7q11.23.
Synonym: deficiency of soluble oxidase component II

Name: autosomal recessive chronic granulomatous disease cytochrome b-negative
Definition: A chronic granulomatous disease characterized by autosomal recessive inheritance that has_material_basis_in mutation in the CYBA gene on chromosome 16q24.2.

Name: autosomal recessive chronic granulomatous disease cytochrome b-positive type III
Definition: A chronic granulomatous disease characterized by that autosomal recessive inheritance has_material_basis_in mutation in the NCF4 gene on chromosome 22q12.
Synonym: chronic granulomatous disease due to NCF4 deficiency

Name: X-linked chronic granulomatous disease
Definition: A chronic granulomatous disease characterized by X-linked inheritance that has_material_basis_in mutation in the CYBB gene on chromosome Xp21.1-p11.4.
Synonym: X-linked chronic cytochrome b-negative granulomatous disease
